page.title: 07VISCOUNT THURSO OF ULBSTER
page.content: { Viscount Thurso of Ulbster}lives at {Thurso East}close to{Mount Pleasant {School.}He succeeded to the title in 1964 on the death of his father, the former{Sir Archibald Sinclair,}who was awarded the title in 1952 because of his distinguished political career. {Viscount Thurso}is Lord Lieutenant of the County of{Caithness}and is an active member of the{House of Lords. His home, at{Thurso East, was once the staff quarters of the now derelict {Thurso Castle}dismantled in 1952 because of severe structural defects. The walls of the present dining room are adorned with portraits of {Lord Thurso's}ancestors and one, which was of particular interest to us, is a Raeburn of{Sir John Sinclair}who compiled the first Statistical Account of Scotland in 1790.
